subject: Sales
title: The Halo Effect in Branding
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Halo Effect in Branding usable.

hook.text: An attractive person is assumed to be smarter and kinder. Brands enjoy the same unfair advantage.

buildup.text: The halo effect means one positive trait makes us assume all other qualities are positive too.

discovery.text: Apple's design creates a halo. Buyers assume software and service must be equally outstanding.

twist.text: Halos work in reverse too. One terrible experience poisons the entire perception of everything else.

climax.text: Invest in your strongest visible trait. A powerful first impression creates a halo covering everything.

punchline.text: One great trait lifts the perception of all others.

quiz.question: How does the halo effect work in branding?
options: One strong positive trait makes people assume everything else is positive
Halos only apply to luxury brands
